intro: Mesembryanthemum calcareum, commonly known as the limestone iceplant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found growing on rocky or limestone outcrops, which is reflected in its common name. Mesembryanthemum calcareum is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to drought and high light conditions.
